thread.title: For Tourists Caught in Bedlam, Hours of Waiting and Wondering...

title: For Tourists Caught in Bedlam, Hours of Waiting and Wondering...
text:
Europe For Tourists Caught in London Bedlam, Hours of Waiting and Wondering ‘It was scary at first,’ recalled one visitor, stranded in the London Eye nearly 44 stories above the Thames A tourist in London recalls watching the aftermath of the terror attack on Wednesday in which at least three people and the assailant were killed. Photo: Getty Images. By @birdyword March 22, 2017 6:43 p.m. ET 
LONDON—When their London Eye gondola suddenly came to a stop nearly 44 stories above the southern bank of the Thames, the visiting Hutchinson family from suburban Boston had no idea why. 
“It was scary at first,” recalled Anne Hutchinson, as she described how she, her husband, Jim, and son Jack, from Lincoln, Mass., were stranded high above London for three hours in one of the British capital’s most iconic attractions.
